intro: Phelipanche aedoi, commonly known as the common morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual that produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers, typically in shades of blue, purple, or white. The plant is characterized by its climbing habit, with tendrils that help it ascend supports. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. Phelipanche aedoi is native to temperate regions of the northern hemisphere and is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
